intro: Eriogonum divaricatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly serrated edge. Eriogonum divaricatum plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for various insects.
